Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 37th overall pick, by Wisconsin in 1950...
Injured on 4/14/1955 with a Pulled Elbow Ligament, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit on 6/8/1957, off Luis Nicks (NE)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/8/1957, off Adan Priddy (DIA)...
Injured on 8/2/1961 with a Inflamed Groin Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 4/16/1962 with a Pulled Abdominal Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Gashouse on 2/3/1964 to a 2-year deal worth $300,000 per year...
Drafted in 5th round, 105th overall pick, by Coney Island in 1967...
Had first career hit on 9/13/1973, off Toney Powell (PON)...
Hit first career homerun on 9/28/1973, off David Trinkle (CC)...
Injured on 4/22/1976 with a Strained Back, out for one week...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/14/1977, hitting .407 with 3 HR, 13 RBI...
Was selected to the 1978 Allstar game...
Traded from Coney Island to Boston (UBA) on 3/2/1982 (Going to CI: 1B J. Dugas. Going to PIL: 2B C. Myer)...
